list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Add Tiptap extensions and dependencies in package.json
Added four new Tiptap extensions: character count, code block lowlight, placeholder, and typography. Also included "highlight.js" and "lowlight" to the list of dependencies in package.json file to enhance the overall functionality of the note management system.

task.summary:
Add new layout and configuration files
Multiple layout, configuration, and routing files were added to extend and scale the project. Along with adding interface components and cargo locks, these files provide additional functionalities to the product such as creating a responsive layout, enabling server-side rendering and pre-rendering, syntax highlighting for TypeScript, and CSharp. Essential gitignore, eslintignore, eslintrc.cjs, and prettier configurations were also included.

Add new layout and configuration files
Multiple layout, configuration, and routing files were added to extend and scale the project. Along with adding interface components and cargo locks, these files provide additional functionalities to the product such as creating a responsive layout, enabling server-side rendering and pre-rendering, syntax highlighting for TypeScript, and CSharp. Essential gitignore, eslintignore, eslintrc.cjs, and prettier configurations were also included.

Add 'TodoList.md' for note-taking app development
The commit introduces a new file 'TodoList.md', which outlines the phases of development for a note-taking application. This file provides a detailed list of core, intermediate, and advance features, including their sub-tasks, that are planned for implementation. The tasks are broadly categorized into markdown editor development, file management, note management, and user customizations.

Add interactive menubar and side navigation in layout
The code improvement primarily adds an interactive menubar with File, Edit, and View menus, along with their respective submenu items in the application layout. Additional code includes side navigation hidden by default and becomes visible on a specific trigger. These changes are aimed to enhance the user interface and provide a streamlined navigation experience.

Implement Markdown editor and directory handling functionalities
Added a Markdown editor and sidebar components to the application layout. The Markdown editor includes presets and plugins for standard markdown syntax, clipboard handling and document view history. The sidebar component fetches and displays note files from a specified directory and allows file selection for editing. Updated Tauri dependencies and configurations accordingly.

Refactor Markdown file and directory handling classes
Renamed MarkdownFileHandler to MarkdownFileManager and Directory to DirectoryManager for clarity. On the markdown editor, implemented plugins including history, clipboard, and markdown syntax, and added functionality for saving changes to the markdown file. Integrated these changes to the sidebar for handling and saving to the correct file.

Refactor Markdown file handling modules with clearer interfaces
Introduced FileOperations interface to clearly define file-related functions. Separated Markdown file handling roles into two classes: TauriFileOperations implements the FileOperations and NoteManager handles notes-related actions. This modular approach simplifies the understanding of the file handling system.

Establish 'EditorStore' and expand markdown editor features
Implemented an 'EditorStore' interface and a corresponding 'editorStore' writable store in stores.ts for an enhanced structural approach. Introduced new plugin methods in index.ts to strengthen the link between the markdown editor and markdown files, thereby increasing code readability and augmenting the markdown editor functionalities.

Update README.md with project's new focus and instructions
The README.md is updated to reflect the new focus on developing a WYSIWYG Markdown App using Svelte, Tauri, and Milkdown. It also includes more detailed setup instructions for potential contributors. The change shows a pivot in the project from a generic Svelte creation to a more specific application.

Implement note addition and deletion features in Sidebar.svelte
The code now includes functions to add and delete notes in Sidebar.svelte. This was achieved by importing and contextualizing the UI context menu. Additionally, the structure and format of Sidebar.svelte was updated to improve navigation and presentation of the notes feature resulting in an enhanced user experience. Furthermore, minor adjustments were made in MarkdownEditor.svelte to correctly update the editor with new markdown content.
fixes small issue on new note or switching between notes the clicking the note cursor doesnt appear instead it selects

Add Titlebar.svelte and update dependencies
This commit introduces the new `Titlebar.svelte` file, which includes window control buttons (minimize, maximize, close) and behavior they trigger. It updates the project dependencies, removing unused packages and adding new ones, which includes a shift from milkdown to tiptap for managing text editing.

Refactor codebase to improve editor store and file handling
This commit includes significant refactorings to facilitate note management and file handling in the application. The EditorStore interface has been replaced with NoteController, which is now utilized to more efficiently handle note content. Additionally, new file handling and saving methods have been introduced along with improvements made to the typing timeout function.

MESSAGE.value:
Add new layout and configuration files
Multiple layout, configuration, and routing files were added to extend and scale the project. Along with adding interface components and cargo locks, these files provide additional functionalities to the product such as creating a responsive layout, enabling server-side rendering and pre-rendering, syntax highlighting for TypeScript, and CSharp. Essential gitignore, eslintignore, eslintrc.cjs, and prettier configurations were also included.

Add 'TodoList.md' for note-taking app development
The commit introduces a new file 'TodoList.md', which outlines the phases of development for a note-taking application. This file provides a detailed list of core, intermediate, and advance features, including their sub-tasks, that are planned for implementation. The tasks are broadly categorized into markdown editor development, file management, note management, and user customizations.

Add interactive menubar and side navigation in layout
The code improvement primarily adds an interactive menubar with File, Edit, and View menus, along with their respective submenu items in the application layout. Additional code includes side navigation hidden by default and becomes visible on a specific trigger. These changes are aimed to enhance the user interface and provide a streamlined navigation experience.

Implement Markdown editor and directory handling functionalities
Added a Markdown editor and sidebar components to the application layout. The Markdown editor includes presets and plugins for standard markdown syntax, clipboard handling and document view history. The sidebar component fetches and displays note files from a specified directory and allows file selection for editing. Updated Tauri dependencies and configurations accordingly.

Refactor Markdown file and directory handling classes
Renamed MarkdownFileHandler to MarkdownFileManager and Directory to DirectoryManager for clarity. On the markdown editor, implemented plugins including history, clipboard, and markdown syntax, and added functionality for saving changes to the markdown file. Integrated these changes to the sidebar for handling and saving to the correct file.

Refactor Markdown file handling modules with clearer interfaces
Introduced FileOperations interface to clearly define file-related functions. Separated Markdown file handling roles into two classes: TauriFileOperations implements the FileOperations and NoteManager handles notes-related actions. This modular approach simplifies the understanding of the file handling system.

Refactor stores.ts and add specific plugins
Refactored 'stores.ts' by creating an interface named 'EditorStore' and initializing new writable store 'editorStore'. Plus, added specific plugins' methods to 'index.ts' that will bridge the functionalities between the editor and the markdown files. This improves code readability, promotes interface-typed design, and provides explicit methods for the markdown editor.

Refactor code and add new editor functionalities
Refactored stores.ts by creating a new 'EditorStore' interface along with a 'editorStore' writable store. Also, new plugin methods were added to index.ts to improve the interaction between the markdown editor and the markdown files. This enhances code readability, encourages an interface-based design approach and augments the markdown editor's capabilities.

Establish 'EditorStore' and expand markdown editor features
Implemented an 'EditorStore' interface and a corresponding 'editorStore' writable store in stores.ts for an enhanced structural approach. Introduced new plugin methods in index.ts to strengthen the link between the markdown editor and markdown files, thereby increasing code readability and augmenting the markdown editor functionalities.

Update README.md with project's new focus and instructions
The README.md is updated to reflect the new focus on developing a WYSIWYG Markdown App using Svelte, Tauri, and Milkdown. It also includes more detailed setup instructions for potential contributors. The change shows a pivot in the project from a generic Svelte creation to a more specific application.

Add note management functionality and update Sidebar.svelte structure
Updated Sidebar.svelte to include methods to add and delete notes, import and contextualize the UI context menu, and restructure formatting for presentation and navigation. These changes enhance the usability and functionality of the notes feature in the application, enabling more user control and interaction.

Implement note addition and deletion features in Sidebar.svelte
The code now includes functions to add and delete notes in Sidebar.svelte. This was achieved by importing and contextualizing the UI context menu. Additionally, the structure and format of Sidebar.svelte was updated to improve navigation and presentation of the notes feature resulting in an enhanced user experience. Furthermore, minor adjustments were made in MarkdownEditor.svelte to correctly update the editor with new markdown content.
fixes small issue on new note or switching between notes the clicking the note cursor doesnt appear instead it selects

Add Titlebar.svelte and update dependencies
This commit introduces the new `Titlebar.svelte` file, which includes window control buttons (minimize, maximize, close) and behavior they trigger. It updates the project dependencies, removing unused packages and adding new ones, which includes a shift from milkdown to tiptap for managing text editing.

Refactor codebase to improve editor store and file handling
This commit includes significant refactorings to facilitate note management and file handling in the application. The EditorStore interface has been replaced with NoteController, which is now utilized to more efficiently handle note content. Additionally, new file handling and saving methods have been introduced along with improvements made to the typing timeout function.

Enhanced note management with new methods in sidebar.ts
Introduced new methods in sidebar.ts such as addNote, deleteNote, getNotes, selectNote to handle note management. Recoded sidebar.svelte to use these methods, and updated the editorStore to handle note metadata more efficiently. Also adjusted related file paths and references accordingly.

Add Tiptap extensions and dependencies in package.json
Added four new Tiptap extensions: character count, code block lowlight, placeholder, and typography. Also included "highlight.js" and "lowlight" to the list of dependencies in package.json file to enhance the overall functionality of the note management system.
